title_sort: handwritten copy of letter from james r. osgood & co. to walt whitman, 21 march 1882
title: Handwritten copy of letter from James R. Osgood & Co. to Walt Whitman, 21 March 1882
creator_sort: James R. Osgood & Co; James R. Osgood & Co.
text: C./James R. Osgood & Co., Publishers211 Tremont St. BostonMarch 21, 1882.Walt Whitman Esq.,Dear Sir:Since our letter of yesterday we have received a memorandum of the passages & lines which are recommended to be Expunged. Please look it through (we enclose it in detail) and advise us at your earliest convenience whether the suggestions meet your approval. In case they do we shall then proceed to consider the mechanical difficulties in the way and how far and how easily they may be overcome.Yours truly,JasJames R. Osgood & Co.D./Passages to be expurgated from Walt Whitman's "Leaves of Grass"Page.Lines.31.15-16 inclusive32.19-22 "37.14-15 "48.20. 28. 2949.11. 20.52.The remainder of paragraph 28 beginning at the 12th line59.11. 12.66.15–16 inclusive79.21-22 "80.Entire passage from 14th line, ending with the line "And you stalwart loins" on page 81.841-7 inclusive8713–2888"A woman waits for me" entire, on 88 and 89th pagesD./PageLines.90.The whole of page 90 and the first half of pages 91 to line 11 inclusive.94.The first six lines and the first half of the 7th line to the words "indecent calls" inclusive.216The ten lines entitled "The Dalliance of the Eagles"266.21. 22.299.The seven lines entitled "To a Common Prostitute" beginning on page 299 and endingingending on page 300303.2–3 inclusive325The remainder of the fourth line from the bottom beginning with the words "he with his palm"331.9. 10.35513–17 inclusive Handwritten copy of letter from James R. Osgood & Co. to Walt Whitman, 21 March 1882
